SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - EVENING - 26th JULY, 1918.
WESTERN FRONT.
(a)French Front. There is no change in the general situation. Between ARGONNE and REIMS hostile Artillery has been very active and local Infantry actions have taken place.
On the MARNE the French have captured REUIL and ANTHAY MILL on the Northern bank, but have been unable to cross the river at PORT-A-BINSON.
Between the MARNE and the OURCQ some progress has been made in the FOREST DE RIS in the direction of L'HEROLLE and South-East of LE CHARMEL.
North of the OURCQ fires have been observed at GRAND ROZOY, BEUGNEUX and CRAMAILLE.
The French have captured 200 prisoners at VILLEMONTOIRE.
North of MONTDIDIER the French have advanced slightly on the right bank of the AVRE, East of CASTEL.
(b) British Front. The situation is unchanged.
ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
Issued at 6.30 p.m.
26th July, 1918.
